trigger: Nuclear <extra_id_0> NF-ATp <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is a hallmark of unstimulated B cells from B-CLL patients .

B lymphocytes from the peripheral blood of patients with chronic lymphocytic leukaemia ( CLL ) were analysed for the nuclear presence and DNA binding of a panel of transcription factors which are involved in the gene control of lymphoid cells .

The following transcription factors were studied : the Octamer factors <extra_id_0> Oct-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> Oct-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , members of the AP-1 factor family , NF-AT factors , in particular <extra_id_0> NF-ATp <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and members of the Rel / NF-kB family .

We show that the constitutive nuclear translocation of <extra_id_0> NF-ATp <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , a member of the growing family of NF-AT factors , is a hallmark of nonstimulated B cells from CLL patients that distinguishes B-CLL cells from 'normal ' B lymphocytes .
Constitutive nuclear appearance was also observed for NF-kB2 / <extra_id_0> p52 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

Constitutive binding of further factor proteins to DNA , such as <extra_id_0> JunD <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> c-Fos <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> FosB <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , was detected in several patients whereas the localisation and DNA binding of other factors such as <extra_id_0> c-Jun <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> RelA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> c-Rel <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> was unaltered .

It is remarkable that in B-CLL cells the nuclear appearance and DNA binding of specific transcription factors is dramatically affected whereas other members of the same factor family remained unaltered in these leukemic cells .

It remains to be shown which molecular events lead to the specific 'pre - activation ' , i.e . constitutive nuclear translocation and DNA binding , of these members of NF-AT , NF-kB and AP-1 factor families .
